ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNACIT: Independent Union of Labour Inspectors and Controllers
NOTES: Workers from the Regional Direction of Labor and Social Security held a sit-in to express discontent with an incident with gendarmes they day before.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UCRB: Union of Burkina Truck Drivers
NOTES: Truck drivers went on a 48 hour strike to improve working conditions. They blocked the route from Ouagadougou to Bobo-Dioulasso.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UCRB: Union of Burkina Truck Drivers
NOTES: Hundreds of truck drivers marched to demand better work and living conditions, including increased wages.

ACTOR1: GMA: Mourabitounes Group of Azawad
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015); Civilians (Romania)
NOTES: 5 gunmen attacked a security vehicle near a mine, shooting and injuring the driver and a policeman and kidnapping a Romanian security officer who was unarmed. They then headed towards Mali or Niger. One month later, Al-Mourabitoun confirmed that they still had the Romanian in their custody.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CDP: Congress for Democracy and Progress
NOTES: While a vote took place to block members of the former regime from upcoming elections, protesters both for and against the amendment chanted in the streets and one group blocked a road and burned tires. Small clashes broke out with the police who used teargas and arrested five.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters marched against political discrimination in light of an upcoming vote to exclude members of the former regime from the next elections.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: About 30 protesters marched against a law that would exclude members of the former regime from upcoming elections. They were dispersed by police using tear gas.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: Unions and civil society organizations launched a general strike to protest high costs of living and around 5,000 people held a protest. Most businesses remained open, with only the University of Ouagadougou following the strike for the entire day.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Thousands marched in protest of high cost of living.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters marched against high costs of living.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters marched against high costs of living.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: An ongoing dispute between farmers and herders in a village near Ziniare led to riots where property was burned and some livestock killed. Police intervened with teargas and arrested three.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Workers from the African Pneumatic Society joined by the UAS union marched to demand payment of housing allowances.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters marched in favor of the new electoral code which excludes supporters of former president Campaore.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Thousands protested in favor of the new electoral code that excludes supporters of former president Campaore.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: University students marched in favor of changing the License-Master-Doctorate system.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Workers marched in protest of high costs of living.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Members of 33 villages in the Sabce commune protested in favor of returning a recently expelled prefect to his position in the municipality.

ACTOR1: Zorgo Communal Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 13 May 2015, a local armed group killed a presumed cattle thief in the Zorgo area (Ganzourgou, Platea-Central).

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: An angry mob attacked and nearly lynched a priest accused of having an affair with a local woman. They beat him and eventually handed him over to the police.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: An angry mob of women armed with knives and axes burned tires and set up barricades in front of the gendarmerie in Saaba to demand the release of an alleged serial rapist and murderer in order to enact vigilante justice.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Residents of Saaba protested to demand better security measures in the area, barricading the National Route 4. Security forces were present and stopped potential clashes between protesters and those trying to use the road.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of protesters marched in Ouagadougou against genetically modified agriculture, especially cotton produced by the Monsanto company.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Dozens gathered at the Dagnoen cemetery in eastern Ouagadougou and chanted nationalist slogans while authorities exhumed the alleged body of Thomas Sanakara, who was assassinated in 1987. Police prevented them from entering the cemetery.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of journalists from public and private press houses demonstrated in front of the media regulatory body against a recent suspension of live radio and TV programs.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Youth marched against homosexuality in the Sikasso-Sira neighborhood of Bobo-Dioulasso, targeting the homes of family members of suspected lesbians.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The resumption of activities by the True Gold mining activity led to riots in Namissiguima. 4 protesters and 3 security forces were injured, a security vehicle was damaged, and 15 were arrested.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Inhabitants from the Outourou and Negueni villages clashed over the proposed construction of a middle school, leaving 3 dead and 20 injured. All of the homes in Outourou were burned.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters came to the Korgho mine 20 km from Gaoua and asked miners to leave, which led to an altercation between the two groups causing at least 8 injuries and property damage. Police arrested some of the perpetrators.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Scholarship students from the University of Ouagadougou held a sit-in to demand that the government renew their scholarships.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015); Women (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Two French soldiers allegedly sexually molested two young girls at a swimming pool in Ouagadougou. The soldiers were repatriated; one was held and one freed. Local police opened an investigation.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Two leaders of the Presidential Guard were questioned by police regarding a potential plot to overthrow President Zida. In response, soldiers from an elite Burkina Faso military unit fired shots into the air in their barracks, and a dozen were arrested after.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: ANEB: National Association of Burkinabe Students
NOTES: Students held a sit-in and submitted a letter of protest to the Ministry of Health demanding better living conditions.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: After a man was taken into police custody for his involvement in an altercation at a market, an angry mob attacked the police station, breaking windows and taking the man into their custody. The crowd beat the man until he was in serious condition and the authorities were able to regain custody.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: In Ouaregou, in the Beguedo district, a dispute between two Muslim brotherhoods degenerated into clashes, resulting in many injuries and material damage.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters from Falangoutou, Gorom-Gorom, Essakane and Markoye came together to demonstrate against the employment practices of the IAMGOLD mining company. At least 28 were arrested for vandalism and destruction of property.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 650 people who were injured in the October 2014 insurrection held a protest in opposition to the candidature of the former ruling party, the CDP.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Gendarmerie
NOTES: Several suspected Islamic militants launched an attack against a gendarmerie brigade near the border with Mali, seriously wounding a young girl and a gendarme who later died from his wounds.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Unidentified individuals attacked and seriously injured a security guard at the independent Radio Manegmoogo in Pissila. Then they set fire to the building.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Youth held a sit-in against the Nantou Mining company.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Employees of SN SOSUCO demonstrated against a recent deal to import sugar from Brazil. They blocked the roads that lead from Banforo to Bobo-Dioulasso and Orodara.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters were arrested while holding a sit-in against the Nantou Mining company.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNAFI: National Union of Finance Agents
NOTES: Workers from the Ministry of Finance went on strike and held a sit-in in front of the Ministry.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of protesters marched against suspected fraud by public servants.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNAFI: National Union of Finance Agents
NOTES: Workers from the Ministry of Finance held a sit-in as part of an ongoing strike. Police dispersed the protesters with tear gas.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Protesters flocked to the presidential palace, where military forces were holding the president and prime minister captive. Gunfire was heard, and one protester was killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Non-violent activity: The Presidential Security Unit took hostage Prime Minister Zida, President Kafando, and two ministers and set up barricades around the presidential palace. The hostages were released late the following day and the president security unit announced it had taken control of the country in a coup. They named themselves the National Council for Democracy and declared General Gilbert Diendere their leader. The closed land and air borders for 24 hours and put a curfew in effect.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Members of the Presidential Security Unit forced radio stations to shut down throughout the capital as they executed a coup at the Presidential Palace. Some journalists were also beaten on the streets as they tried to cover the situation.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters took to the streets in Bobo-Dioulasso. They set fire to the home of a member of the CDP.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters set up barricades and lowered government flags in reaction to a recent coup.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: At least two anti-coup protesters were killed and 60 injured by soldiers.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters took to the streets in reaction to a recent coup, setting up citizen committees to 'defend democracy'.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters took to the streets in reaction to a recent coup, setting up citizen committees to 'defend democracy'.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters set up barricades in reaction to a recent coup.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The homes of two former Compaore allies (Simon Compaore and Salif Diallo) were ransacked by anti-coup rioters.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters in the Ouagadougou areas of Hamdalaye, Larle, Gounghin, Zogona, and Zone 1 erected barricades and lit tyres. Security forces shot at protesters, killing at least seven and injuring at least 80.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters in the Ouagadougou areas of Hamdalaye, Larle, Gounghin, Zogona, and Zone 1 erected barricades and lit tyres. Security forces shot at protesters, killing at least seven and injuring at least 80.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters in the Ouagadougou areas of Hamdalaye, Larle, Gounghin, Zogona, and Zone 1 erected barricades and lit tyres. Security forces shot at protesters, killing at least seven and injuring at least 80.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters in the Ouagadougou areas of Hamdalaye, Larle, Gounghin, Zogona, and Zone 1 erected barricades and lit tyres. Security forces shot at protesters, killing at least seven and injuring at least 80.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters in the Ouagadougou areas of Hamdalaye, Larle, Gounghin, Zogona, and Zone 1 erected barricades and lit tyres. Security forces shot at protesters, killing at least seven and injuring at least 80.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters continued to march in Bobo-Dioulasso, ignoring the newly imposed curfew.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Anti-coup protesters marched in Gaoua.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Youth and other protesters blocked the western entrance to Ouagadougou, setting fire to tires to put pressure on coup leaders.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 50 anti-coup protesters gather at Independence Square before being turned away by police and heading towards Laico Hotel, where mediations were being held.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CDP: Congress for Democracy and Progress
NOTES: On 20 September 2015, coup supporters of the CDP burned tires and attacked foreign ambassadors and anti-coup supporters in front of the Laico Hotel in Ouagadougou (Kadiogo, Centre), where mediations were being held. The security forces intervened and fired shots.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: 1 presidential security soldier killed, another injured in attack by unknown group on outskirts of Ouagadougou.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Rioters burned tries in the street in protest of the draft agreement between military and coup leaders, which proposed to allow loyalists of former President Compoare and members of former ruling party to participate in elections.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Citizens Broom; Mossi Ethnic Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 2000 protesters, including from Citizens Broom, surrounded the home of Mossi ethnic traditional chief Mogho Naba, chanting for his surrender for suspected involvement in the coup.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Citizens Broom rioters burned tires and stretched cables on the roads in Tampouy, protesting against the ECOWAS-mediated proposed amnesty for coup leaders.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Agreement: Interim President Kafando resumes power after week-long coup, signing a peace deal with the Presidential Security Unit.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: The army used gunfire to take over the Presidential Security Unit barracks where coup supporters were refusing to disarm. The Presidential Security Unit surrendered, and the government reports there were no casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2014-2015)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Soldiers were seen throughout the Ouaga 2000 district of Ouagadougou looking for members of the Presidential Security Unit. Marksmen were seen in positions around the Presidential Security barracks.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students smashed windows and surrounded cars while protesting at Kossodo University, demanding that classes resume since the coup events of September have finished.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Dozens of workers from the Bissa Gold mining company held a sit-in to demand payment of September salaries.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Three police were killed in a raid on their barracks carried out by at least 30 attackers - perhaps jihadists' connected to a simultaneous attack in the Mopti region of Mali, or troops associated with a recent failed coup in Burkina Faso. 1 assailant and 1 civilian were also killed.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students blocked routes to the university in Bobo-Dioulasso and overtook canteens on campus, demanding the reopening of certain buildings, reductions in rent, increased bus access, and improvements in food service.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students encircled and overtook the administrative building of the General Directorate of the National Center of Academic Affairs, demanding the dismissal of the Director General and retraction of previous vandalism charges.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Artisans held a sit-in to demand better conditions in the artisanal village.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protests against poor municipal management caused the local Prefect official to flee town.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Public university students marched as part of a strike against administrative policies.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Officers of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs held a sit-in to demand administrative changes.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Residents in the Dapoya neighborhood of Ouagadougou protested against the closing of a health center.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: F-SYNTER: Federation of National Unions of Workers in Education and Research
NOTES: Union members held a sit-in to demand better working conditions at the International Institute for Water and Environmental Engineering (2iE).

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Residents of the Toudweogo neighborhood in Ouagadougou held a spontaneous protests against poor road conditions, blocking the road.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Employees of SN-SOSUCO went on strike and started camping out in front of the factory.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Staff of the International Engineering Institute protested the recent firings of teachers by blocking roads into campus.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: Protesters marched against 'dysfunctional' city services, including water cuts and poorly run hospitals.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen attacked the convey of a mining company, killing a driver and exchanging fire with security guards before fleeing.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Suspected jihadists with rocket launchers and automatic rifles attacked an armored cash truck near the Inata gold mine, killing the driver and wounding another. Police fought off the attackers.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Police used gunfire and tear gas to remove striking employees from the premises of the SN-SOSUCU sugar factory. The protesters returned and forced through the police line. A fire damaged the factory and injuries were reported on both sides.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Security forces pushed protesting workers from the SN-SOSUCO factory workers, arresting 26. Several injuries on both sides.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Secondary school teachers held a sit-in to demand payment of salaries.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: New teacher recruits held a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Secondary and Higher Education

ACTOR1: Al Mourabitoune Battalion
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
NOTES: 30 killed, including at least 14 foreigners, when Al Mourabitoun fighters backed by AQIM attacked a restaurant and hotel. At least 32 wounded.

ACTOR1: Al Mourabitoune Battalion
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
NOTES: Al-Qaida linked 'Emirate of the Sahara' group kidnapped an elderly Australian couple. On February 6th, Al Mourabitoune claimed responsibility for this event, also stating that he carried out the kidnapping under Al Qaedas orders.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Around 20 armed men attacked security patrols, killing one civilian and one police officer.

ACTOR1: Al Mourabitoune Battalion
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
NOTES: After Al Mourabitoun fighters backed by AQIM attacked a restaurant and hotel, military troops backed by French special forces battled to regain control. At least three militants killed.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters marched to express discontent with the recent kidnapping of an Australian couple.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students from the National School of Public Health held a sit-in to demand better study conditions.

ACTOR1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Around a dozen former members of the military attacked an arms depot, injuring a guard and stealing several weapons.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds marched to pay homage to the victims of the recent attack on Splendid Hotel and to demonstrate their resistance against terrorism.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
ACTOR2: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Near the border with Ghana, military exchanged gunfire with a group suspected of involvement in a recent armory raid. One was killed and five arrested.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students and interns from the University of Koudougou and the Ecole Normale Superieure marched to demand resumption of classes which have stalled due to teacher strikes.

ACTOR1: Fulani Ethnic Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: One person was killed and one severely injured in a inter-communal conflict between Peul and Mossi groups. Six Mossi were arrested for potential involvement.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: After six Mossi were arrested for their suspected involvement in intercommunal violence with Peul, a group of Mossi burned Peul homes

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Vigilantes in Koglewego in the Sapouy district arrested and beat a presumed thief who later died of his injuries.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 18 February 2016, around 1000 from a local armed group confronted police without violence in Sapouy (Ziro, Centre-Ouest). Police were investigating the recent death of a presumed thief. The confrontation ended without violence and with the release of an elderly prisoner.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Technical and vocational school students marched to demand improved study conditions.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Three people were killed on Wednesday in intercommunal clashes in Kourou, 200 km from Burkinas capital.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Surgery center workers held a sit-in and went on a 24 hour strike.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Vigilantes from several villages came to Kompienbiga to capture and torture a presumed cattle thief and his brother. Gendarmes arrested the two victims and ten vigilantes.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 11 March 2016, hundreds demonstrated to demand the release of nine who were arrested for torturing a presumed cattle thief and his brother. Security forces on alert but no clashes reported.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The people of Gnagna protested peacefully against the deterioration of roads in their area.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 12 March 2016, for a second day, hundreds demonstrated to demand the release of someone arrested for torturing a presumed cattle thief and his brother. Security forces on alert but no clashes reported.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Vigilante mob lynched a prisoner accused of murdering two moneychangers.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: Vigilante mob attacked gendarmes station in order to retrieve a suspected murderer, injuring four gendarmes and setting fires.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Chad)
NOTES: Hundreds of Chadian students held a sit-in in front of the Chad Embassy after their scholarships were cut and they were expelled from the Institute of Engineering, Water, and the Environment.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Toll workers held a sit-in to demand a change in employment status.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Toll workers held a sit-in to demand a change in employment status.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters marched to demand the liberation of vigilantes held for attacking a presumed cattle thief and his brother a week before. Clashes led to one military injured, arrests, and confiscation of motorcycles.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters continued marching to demand the liberation of vigilantes, 'harassing' security forces who dispersed them. Injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters demanding the release of imprisoned vigilantes set up road blocks.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: ANEB: National Association of Burkinabe Students
NOTES: Students marched to denounce poor study conditions.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SOTRACO: Union of Transport Company Workers of Ouagadougou Commune
NOTES: Transport workers held a sit-in to denounce poor management.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Vigilantes beat and whipped two suspected thieves, demanding they pay a fine before letting them go.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students rioted, tearing the flag, burning property, and attacking teachers.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The headquarters of the New Alliance of Faso (NAFA) was attacked by the activists of Peoples Movement for Progress (MPP) who ransacked the office, injuring the members of the party. The event occurred the week prior the launch of the electoral campaign.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Angry mob burned a car that allegedly killed a motorcyclist.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters against alleged police brutality threw missiles at police stations and ransacked officers homes. Police dispersed them several times using tear gas.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Mali)
NOTES: Four men attacked police station at Loropeni, the attackers are speculated to be 'jihadists from Mali'.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Angry residents ransacked local offices of the National Independent Electoral Commission (CENI) ahead of municipal elections.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: High school students destroyed office furniture and set fire to at least two teachers motorbikes to express discontent with exam policies.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Angry residents ransacked local offices of the National Independent Electoral Commission (CENI) ahead of municipal elections.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Young entrepreneurs held a sit-in outside the Prime Ministers office to demand funding.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Mali)
NOTES: Armed men attacked police station, injuring two. Attackers may be 'jihadists from Mali.'

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: MPP activists tried to stop NTD supporters from voting. Police intervened. No reports of violence

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Four political parties joined to march to protest cancelled municipal elections.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Tollbooth workers launched a three-day nationwide sit-in.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Mali)
NOTES: 'Jihadists' on motorbikes attacked a police station 5km from the border with Mali, killing three and stealing weapons.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CNOSC: Consultation Framework for Civil Society Organizations
NOTES: 100 activists protested against bail for various members of the former regime suspected of involvement in reprisals against civilians in October 2014 and in September 2015.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Bakers went on strike. Dozens protested in front of the Ministry of Public Service to demand better living and working conditions.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Workers from the Ministry of Women, National Solidarity, and Family held a sit in to denounce outsider appointments.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of protesters with clubs and machetes blocked the Ouagadougou-Dori road, demanding the MPP candidate be named mayor.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: About 20 relatives of detainees protested outside a prison, demanding their loved ones receive speedy trials and be released in accordance with their sentences.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: After a disputed mayoral election, opposing political groups clashed. One MPP activist killed and around a dozen injured.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Disputes over local chief led to clashes, one killed.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: After a disputed mayoral election, opposing political groups clashed, causing several injuries.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Two killed and at least 30 wounded in clashes between political opponents after contested mayoral election.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Burkina Faso); Government of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Political opponents attacked and injured the newly elected mayor from the Fulani ethnic group, setting his home on fire.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Political opponents attacked the newly elected mayor, who was hospitalized for his injuries.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Mineral transporters protested regarding tariffs.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 24 June 2016, locals armed with clubs, knives and machetes fought with a communal armed group in a suburb of Ouagadougou (Kadiogo, Centre) who attempted to arrest a thief. Five injured and several vigilantes later arrested.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Former Military Forces of Burkina Faso (1987-2014)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: 100 former soldiers who took part in the 2011 attempted coup protested in front of the Ministry of Defense, demanding reinstatement in the military. Gendarmes blocked them from reaching the Ministry.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Zongho residents protested the recent arrest of vigilantes, blocking national route 1. Authorities tried to negotiate and then used tear gas to disperse them.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Strikes: Toll workers went on a 72 hour strike nationwide, demanding better working conditions and re-privatization.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CDAIP: Coordination of Defense Committees and Deepening the Gains of the Popular Uprising
NOTES: Nearly 300 traders in the 3rd quarter of Ouagadougou held a sit-in and 'faced off' with police who were ordered to 'interrupt' the protest. Eventually, the mayor agreed to receive leaders for negotiations.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A vigilante militant killed a rider in Yonde.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNATIC: Autonomous Syndicate of Information and Culture Workers
NOTES: SYNATIC workers staged a sit-in to demand attention to their grievances.

ACTOR1: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
NOTES: 2 customs officials (including a border guard) were killed in an attack on the border town of Markoye. 3 people were also wounded. The assailants stole customs money and fled to the Nigerien border. The leader of the Islamic States Sahara division claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The civil registry of Sabse department was burned down by demonstrators demanding the dissolution of a newly-installed city council in the area.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Arrests: Burkina Fasos former PM under the government of President Blaise Compaore, Luc-Adolphe Tiao, was arrested on charges of murder.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers began a 4-day, 4-hour work stoppage at the Yalgado-Ouedraogo hospital along with sit-ins to draw attention to their grievances.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: SYNATEL began a strike and sit-in at ONATEL to demand resolution of their grievances.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Former workers of Bissa Gold staged a sit-in to demand their unpaid severance following their October 2015 dismissals.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Workers of the National Blood Transfusion Centre held a 48-hour sit-in outside the premises of the centre in Ouagadougou to demand the implementation of a rebate to the centres workers.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: About 5,000 people demonstrated for the release of Djibril Bassole, a former Foreign Minister of President Campaores government, in his hometown of Reo. He was arrested in mid-September.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Primary teachers of Boulgou province protested in Tankodogo to demand an education conference that was meant to be held in 2015 be held.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CNSE: National Coordination of Education Unions; Teachers (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The CNSE organized a protest march of sixteen teachers unions to commemorate World Teachers Day and deliver a memo to the Minister of Education.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Residents of the Soubeira area marched to Kaya to demand the involvement of the regional administrator in the resolution of a dispute in their area.

ACTOR1: Former Military Forces of Burkina Faso (1987-2014)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: 4 assailants accosted 2 gendarmes and attempted to steal their weapons near the Po gendarmerie station at Nazinon. 2 of the suspects were killed, while one of the attackers and a police officer were wounded. The government later claimed they were members of the disbanded Presidential Security Regiment.

ACTOR1: Former Military Forces of Burkina Faso (1987-2014)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Burkina Fasos Minister of Territorial Administration, Decentralization and Homeland Security claims that a coup attempt was foiled on Oct.8 which had been organized by members of the disbanded Presidential Security Regiment. Members of the former regiment who did not participate allegedly informed the government about the plan.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNATRACT: National Union of Workers of the Local Authorities
NOTES: Staff of the regional authority engaged in a protest strike and demonstrated in front of the Ouagadougou Labour Exchange to demand attention to their grievances. The general secretary of SYNATRACT was in attendance.

ACTOR1: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
NOTES: 3 soldiers and 2 civilians were killed in an attack on a military position in Intangom, near Tin Akoff. 1 soldier was also wounded during the incident. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara later claimed the attack. Another soldier later died of his injuries.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Mali)
NOTES: About 8 heavily-armed unidentified assailants, believed to have crossed the border from Mali, attacked Kerboule village, in the Nassoumbou area. They killed 4 people and injured one before Kolgweogo self-defense militiamen from Boulsa arrived, causing the gunmen to retreat. The gunmen were allegedly speaking in Fulani.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Mali)
NOTES: About 8 heavily-armed unidentified assailants, believed to have crossed the border from Mali, attacked Kerboule village, in the Nassoumbou area. They killed 4 people and injured one before Kolgweogo self-defense militiamen from Boulsa arrived, causing the gunmen to retreat. The gunmen were allegedly speaking in Fulani.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The Minister of Internal Security claimed that a 'jihadist recruiter' armed with a grenade was killed by security forces in the Kilwin neighbourhood of Ouagadougou.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNATIC: Autonomous Syndicate of Information and Culture Workers
NOTES: The Independent Union of Workers of information and culture (Synatic) start 96 hours of general strike. The strikers decided to set up their picket outside the headquarters of the National Television of Burkina. But there, they were stopped by security forces deployed there.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Several thousand people in the city of Yendabli took the street in tribute to the victims of the uprising population of 30 and 31 October 2014 and the failed coup of 16 September 2015 in Fada-NGourma.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNATEB: National Union of Basic Education Workers; Teachers (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Teachers of the National Union of Basic Education Workers section Bourzanga, observed a 48h work stoppage.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A councilman of the village of Soboule, 30 kilometers from Nassoumbou, was wounded by unidentified armed man. While his gun jammed, the attacker was then lynched by the crowd, who then handed over to the defense and security forces.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Amadou Boli, the Imam preacher in sector 5 of Djibo and number 2 of Irshad (Network of preachers), was attacked at his home by armed men. While the motive under this murdr is unclear, a showdown seems to be behind this attack.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: In Petega, 30 kilometers from Nassoumbou, Tamboura Amadou Oumarou, a village councilman, was murdered by four bullets in the head, and Dicko Hamadoum, a village resident, was kidnapped by the armed men.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A councilman of the village of Soboule, 30 kilometers from Nassoumbou, was wounded by unidentified armed man. While his gun jammed, the attacker was then lynched by the crowd, who then handed over to the defense and security forces.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: Members of the National Union of Human and Animal Health (SYNTSHA), observed a sit-in on Nov. 16 and 17 at the regional hospital in Ouahigouya. The protesters demand the satisfaction of their platform of demands.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: Members of the National Union of Human and Animal Health (SYNTSHA), observed a sit-in on Nov. 16 and 17 at the regional hospital in Ouahigouya. The protesters demand the satisfaction of their platform of demands.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 100 youths marched in Banfora to protest against actions by some politicians to block the Banfora city council and dismiss the mayor.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Health workers marched on the second day of their 72-hour strike to demand better security for them at their workplaces.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: Gendarmerie from Koudougou shot dead a man 'dressed all in white and turbaned' who refused police demands to stop as he was traveling towards their post.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Supporters of an MPP mayor of Ouagadougous 8th district staged violent protests after a vote of no confidence went against the mayor. The rioters ransacked and burned the homes of three councillors from the UPC and 2 from the MPP.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of demonstrators engaged in 13 minutes of silence and staged a sit-in outside the Ouagadougou courthouse to demand action over the death of an investigative journalist, Norbert Zongo.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People of the Tangin Dassouri rural commune staged a peaceful march to demand that the authorities release Adam Zongo, a former mayor and former president of the FEDAP/BC.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: At least 12 soldiers were killed in an attack by about 40 heavily armed gunmen on a Burkinabe military post on the border with Mali at Nassoumbou. An al-Qaeda-linked group calling itself Ansaroul Islam claimed the attack.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students and parents fought, resulting in several wounded, 15 motorcycles wrecked, and some damage to property, in a high school theatre in Niangoloko. The violence was related to a local school dispute.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNAPAR: National Union of Research Support Staff
NOTES: SYNAPAR members staged a sit-in at the Institute of Environment and Agricultural Research in Ouagadougou to demand a sepcific allowance and expansion of a premium for their research.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Members of an Al Qaeda affiliated group, Ansaroul Islam, killed an imam in a reprisal attack in the Tongomayel commune, in the village of Sibe. The imam had allegedly deserted the group.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Members of an Al Qaeda affiliated group, Ansaroul Islam, seriously injured anotther former member of the group in Djibo. The man was allegedly a deserter of the group.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: An assassination was conducted in the Sibe area. The identity of the target was not reported. Ansaroul Islam claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Non-violent activity: An assassination attempt was reported in the Djibo area. Ansaroul Islam claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Rallies were held against the continued use of the CFA in Burkina Faso.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Suspected Islamist fighters attacked the Kerboule mining site in Soum province, killing one Koglweogo member and 3 miners, injuring one other, and stealing 6 motorcycles and an unspecified sum of money. Islamist militias have been known to operate in the area.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: The Union of Lawyers of Burkina Faso (SYNAF) reported that a lawyer had been assaulted by police while he had been attempting to interview a defendant who had been in custody for more than 5 days.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: One person was killed and another injured when Burkinabe soldiers fired warnings shots at approaching motorcycles in the Banh area of Loroum province.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 1,500 people marched silently in Ouagadougou to mark the anniversary of the Hotel Splendid attack.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students in Santa blocked National Road No.7 to demand attention to their grievances.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Retired police and soldiers protested and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Defence and Veteran's Affairs in Ouagadougou over the government's non-implementation of a shift in the retirement age.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Heavily armed Islamist militants were reported to have forced their way into schools in areas around Baraboule, including the Petega area of Pelem-Pelem and Lassa, and demanded teachers instruct their students on Islam and the Quran and stop teaching French. Burkinabe soldiers have been deployed to the area following the incidents.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: A crowd forced the release of 8 people imprisoned at a police station in Bagre. Following the events, clashes were reported between the rioters and police, which were later reinforced by gendarmerie forces. 37 people were arrested after the incident. No casualties were reported but some property was damaged.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A municipal councilor and his son were killed by unidentified assailants in the Yorsala area, near Titao.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNAFI: National Union of Finance Agents
NOTES: SYNAFI workers began an 11 day sit-in outside the ministry to demand their grievances be addressed.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: ONTTB: National Organisation of Burkinabe Land Carriers
NOTES: Truck drivers of the ONTTB protested and blocked the Ouaga-Kaya intersection to demand fewer road checks. They threatened to strike if nothing was done.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYTTBHA: Workers Union of Public Works, Building, Water and Similar
NOTES: SYTTBHA workers protested and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Infrastructure to demand resolution of their grievances.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Employees Safety Assistance Volunteers (VADS) personnel starting to demonstrate in front of the governorate building in Bobo-Dioulasso were quickly cleared by police who used tear gas and batons. A police spokesman said the protest was illegal. No injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Youths, civil society members and traders blocked Coulibaly Avenue to protest the suspension of asphalting of the avenue.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Ansaroul Islam fighters attacked 2 police stations in northern Burkina Faso at Baraboule and Tongomayel, injuring the wife of a police officer and destroying as many as 19 police motorcycles.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Ansaroul Islam fighters attacked 2 police stations in northern Burkina Faso at Baraboule and Tongomayel, injuring the wife of a police officer and destroying as many as 19 police motorcycles.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Property destruction: Diguel was attacked by suspected Ansaroul Islam fighters in the early morning of Feb.28. They ransacked the mayors office, stole some property and burned down a prefecture building.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: On 3 March 2017, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants killed a school principal and another civilian in an attack on a school in Kourfayel (Djibo, Soum).

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Schools in the Fourtenga commune of Nassere (Kongoussi) were visited by suspected Islamist militants who threatened to close them down if the teachers did not start teaching in Arabic.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Teachers marched in Ouagadougou and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Education to protest against initimidation of teachers in Soum by suspected Islamist militants.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Property destruction: A school was burned down in the Baraboule area by suspected Islamist militants. Islamist groups, particularly Ansaroul Islam, have been targeting schools and teachers in the area recently.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNAGRH: National Union of Human Resource Managers and Public Administration
NOTES: SYNAGRH members protested and started a 72-hour sit-in in Ouagadougou to demand attention to their grievances.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Koglweogo militiamen and an unidentified armed group clashed in the Kereboule area. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: A gendarme was injured in an attack by unidentified assailants in an ambush in the Petega area.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The National Union of Tax Estate Agents started a strike and protested in the capital in favour of their demands.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Unidentified assailants attacked a joint-police/military camp in Nassoumbou. At least one soldier was wounded in a rocket attack, although gunfire was also reported.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A youth organization (ODJ) organized a sit-in in Koudougou to protest against water shortages in the city.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: A suspected Ansaroul Islam lieutenant was killed by security forces in the Petega area near Djibo. 18 other suspected militants were also arrested.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Unidentified armed individuals on motorcycles raided the HQ of the Koglweogo in Kereboule, which they found empty. They then opened fire for nearly a quarter of an hour before leaving. At least one person was seriously injured during the firing.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Security Measures: Burkinabe soldiers backed by Barkhane forces have started a large-scale search and clear operation in Soum province. Malian forces are also participating across the border.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Kolgweogo in Pouytenga and surrounding areas gathered in Koupela to protest over the alleged condemnation of their comrades.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNATEB: National Union of Basic Education Workers
NOTES: The SYNATEB affiliated gathered in front of the town hall for a sit-in asking the revision of a new document imposting heavier administrative burden on workers.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AFKK: Koglweogo Womens Association of Kouritenga; Women (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The women's association Koglweogo Kouritenga protested against a court decision against some of their husbands related to some vigilante activities.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Residents of Douna staged a march in support of the mayor over alleged activity against him by local representatives of the CDP and the UPC.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Youth Coordination Bual Hamu blocked Road 4 Fada-Niger borders to ask for the road to be asphalted.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: About 200 police protested in Ouagadougou over the alleged lack of transparency over their provision of security to private companies.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 44 people were arrested in the Pama and Nadiagou area after protests and arson attacks related to the shooting death of an alleged poacher in the area.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 44 people were arrested in the Pama and Nadiagou area after protests and arson attacks related to the shooting death of an alleged poacher in the area.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: People massively protested against the bad conditions of roads in the Eastern region.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: People massively protested against the bad conditions of roads in the Eastern region.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: People massively protested against the bad conditions of roads in the Eastern region.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: People massively protested against the bad conditions of roads in the Eastern region.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: People massively protested against the bad conditions of roads in the Eastern region.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students took hostage the mayor asking for the withdrawal of the administrative document.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Students (Burkina Faso); UAS: Trade Union Action Unit
NOTES: 7 persons were wounded by police forces after police responded to the march of the UAS towards the town hall. Finally, the administrative document was declared void.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Angry protesters shut one of the main markets in Bobo-Dioulasso and marched to the governorates offices to submit a protest letter over poor roadways.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Some traders demonstrated in front of the Palace of Justice against the detention of Inoussa Kanazoe, President-director general de CIMFASO.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Mutiny of Police Forces of Burkina Faso (1987-2014)
NOTES: A hundred former policemen, expelled from police forces after the 2011 mutiny, organised a sit-in to ask for their re-integration.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 2 Water Department workers were abducted by unidentified assailants in the Tin-Akoff area. They were later released.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Two Burkinabe state officers were kidnapped and released in the night.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: An unidentified man was shot down at the entrance of the military camp of Fada-N'Gourma after he did not stop despite the security warnings.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UPC: Union for Progress and Reform; CDP: Congress for Democracy and Progress
NOTES: Nearly 5,000 supporters of the opposition, primarily UPC and CDP activists, gathred in Ouagadougou outside the People's House for a rally against the government.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Workers walk down to the street to ask for an increase of salaries and purchasing power.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A burkinabe vet was kidnapped by unidentified men in Forage Christine. He was later found the following day.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Gorane Dicko member of Ansaroul Islam and relative of Harouna Dicko - killed in March - was 'neutralised' by military forces.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: Guezouma Sanogo, journalist and president of the journalist association (AJB), was beaten up by a policeman while at the Peasant National Day in Kaya.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen killed a village councilman and wounded another by gunfire in N'Diahoye.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Koglweogo Militia members were beaten up by Tialgo people after an attempt to fine a local family scaled up tensions and resulted in an injury. 3 dead and several wounded, while 3 youths were abducted by Koglweogos and 5 Koglweogos detained by the Gendarmerie.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Hundreds of people demonstrated claiming for truth and justice about Dabo Boukary assassination in 1990.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A Koglweogo Militia member killed two young people. He was later lynched by the population.

ACTOR1: Koglweogo Militia
NOTES: A Koglweogo Militia member killed two young people. He was later lynched by the population.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Civil society organisations gathered to protest against persisting impunity of blood and economic crimes.

ACTOR1: Dabre Clan Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People from the Dabre and Zampaligre families clashed over the enthronement of the new customary chief belonging to the Zampaligre family: the two dead and five wounded belong all to the Zampaligre family.

ACTOR1: Moba Ethnic Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: In the Koyinga village of Sangha, clashes between the Moba and Yaana ethnies over a land conflict resulted in one dead, one wounded and several material damages

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Demonstration against the attempted lynching of artist Adja Divine organised by Burkina Association of Artists.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Retired policeman shot dead by 'unknown gunmen': his wife was wounded by gunshot. 1 of the assailants was later killed by a group of security forces and a vigilante militia. The house of the Grand Imam of Djibo was also subjected to gunfire. Gunmen later identified as Anseroul Islam.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022); Muslim Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 27 May 2017, Anseroul Islam shot and killed a retired policeman and wounded his wife and fired upon the home of the Grand Imam in Djibo (Soum, Sahel). Police forces and a communal group later clashed on the same day (coded separately).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 27 May 2017, Anseroul Islam clashed with police forces and a Djibo communal militia in Djibo (Soum, Sahel). These clashes follow an attack in the same place this day (coded separately). 1 Anseroul Islam militant was killed in the clash.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Five people were killed by armed men in the area close to Malian border. Three were killed in Pogouwol in the Soum Depertement, while one in Petega and another in Kourou.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Five people were killed by armed men in the area close to Malian border. Three were killed in Pogouwol in the Soum Depertement, while one in Petega and another in Kourou.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Five people were killed by armed men in the area close to Malian border. Three were killed in Pogouwol in the Soum Depertement, while one in Petega and another in Kourou.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A march for the peace was organised by the FEME.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People asking for the liberation of a prisoner vandalised the Justice Palace.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Mali)
NOTES: A group of 6 unknown gunmen attacked the village of Woba-Tila near Belehede. They allegedly withdrew towards Mali.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A local council member and a farmer were killed by unidentified aggressors.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People went to the street and blocked traffic circulation to protest about a land issue.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People protested in front of the Prefecture asking the mayor to step back.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The demonstration against the bad conditions of the RNo4 failed to gather a significant number of people.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Jafar Dicko assumed the leadership of Ansaroul Islam, Maalam Dicko supposedly dead.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Former mutinous policemen fired in 2012 demonstrated asking for their integration.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNACSAB: National Union of Civil Servants, Secretaries and Administrative Assistants of Burkina Faso
NOTES: A sit-in was organised by SYNACSAB to protest the bad working conditions.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: SYNACSAB - public officers' Labour Union - organised a sit-in in front of High Commission building in Bam capital city asking for better work conditions.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: CDP: Congress for Democracy and Progress
NOTES: CDP president denounced several recent acts of violence against its members in Ouagadougou, including the intrusion of armed men within the house of the former party president, who beat his mother and wounded his son; as well as the shooting at a former minister's window.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Clashes between sector 5 and sector 1 youngsters were reported: prompted by the undressing of a traditional 'mask', violence erupted triggering significant material damages.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Civil society organisation organised a march protesting the motion of deposition against the Gourcy Major.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People demonstrated to support Mayor Dominique Sourabie.

ACTOR1: Fulani Ethnic Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Inhabitants fought Fulani herders after cattle damaged field in Doussoula, Sourou province in north west on 11 July. One killed.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Mali)
NOTES: Suspected jihadists opened fire on a police patrol in the Doumbala area and fled towards the Malian border.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Zoetgomde village people interrupted a 'comunity day' going on in the Kinshasa neighbourhood to protest the expropriation and selling of their agricultural land.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: On 17 July 2017, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a prominent goldminer in Kerboule, he was released nine months later.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNAID: National Union of Tax Agents
NOTES: SYNAID workers organized a four-day long sit-in protesting against the lack of implimented changes from a previous agreement. The protesters occupied a main square in the capital and there were interactions with police but no violence or arrests were mentioned. The government declared that public offices will not close.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A Kourfadji inhabitant was kidnapped by presumed terrorists.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Report of acts of vandalism in Sapone commune, Bazega province (Centre-Sud) prior to the holding of a local administration session on 23 July, with some people setting up barricades along the main roads and destroying private properties.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: Human and animal health workers in Dedougou, Mouhoun section, led by SNYTSHA, held a sit-in on 24 and 25 July calling for better working conditions.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNACIT: Independent Union of Labour Inspectors and Controllers
NOTES: SYNACIT organised a 48-hours sit-in protesting the material work conditions.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A series of attacks by unidentified gunmen in Ndidja, Neyba and Sibe villages of Djibo left at least 5 dead, including 2 in Ndidka and 2 in Sibe. Authorities believe the attacks were part of an internal rift between armed groups in the area. The victims were identified as members of Anseroul Islam, while the attackers are unknown

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNAGRH: National Union of Human Resource Managers and Public Administration
NOTES: SYNAGRH workers went on a 48-hours sit-in protesting negotiations' lack of results.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Another serie of assassinations by unidentified gunmen in the Soum Province, a councilman & two of his family members in Kenou, also one in Petega.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Another serie of assassinations by unidentified gunmen in the Soum Province, a councilman & two of his family members in Kenou, also one in Petega.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Dozens of people and local representatives marched in Karkuidghin in Sapone commune, Bazega province (Centre-Sud) to show their support to the Mayor of Sapone.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People set up barricades along the Ouaga-Leo-Frontiere du Ghana route protesting the raise of electricity price.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: A soldier shot and killed a civilian working for an oil company in Balole locality, Bingo dept, in unclear circumstances.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A civilian was shot and killed by unknown gunmen on 30 July in unclear circumstances in Sona, Tongomayel commune of Sahel province. Authorities believe the attack to be linked to the presence of terrorist groups in the area.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A soldier shot and killed a civilian working for an oil company in Balole locality, Bingo dept, in unclear circumstances. Citizens from Balole locality erected a barricade on the road leading to the oil site the following day to protest the killing and to call for justice. Rocks were thrown when authorities came to negotiate with the rioters, but it is unclear if they hit the authorities.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Populations of Goudin village set up barricades along the national road 4 (from Nioko, Bendogo and up to Fada) to protest the arrest of 6 Koglweogo leaders from their village without charge. They were chased by security forces, who also fired tear gas to disperse them. Police arrested six rioters.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UCRB: Union of Burkina Truck Drivers
NOTES: Truck drivers blocked traffic on national road 16, at Tenkodogo, to protest the reintroduction of licence fees. Police intervened to disperse them, leading to clashes and tear gas throwing.

ACTOR1: Diebougou Communal Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Clashes between gold miners and land owners from the Diebougou region at at the Loto mining site, 5km from Diebougou in Bougouriba, in the south west of Burkina Faso, left one killed and 10 injured, including 3 severely. Material damage was also reported, including a truck that was burnt down.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Armed assault on restaurant Aziz Istanbul. 19 dead, minaly foreign citizens, a dozen wounded and 2 assailants killed by Burkinabe special forces' assault. Attackers were suspected to be Islamists but no individual groups have claimed responsibility yet.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Armed assault on restaurant Aziz Istanbul. 19 dead, a dozen wounded and 2 assailants killed by Burkinabe special forces' assault. Attackers were suspected to be Islamists but no individual groups have claimed responsibility yet.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 3 dead and several wounded in IED/mine blast that struck an army vehicle in the area of Inata.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: A thousand people went to the streets to protest against violence and terrorist attacks.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Movement of forces: Incursion by presumed Ansaroul Islam members who fired in the air & threatened locals in Damba

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: People from Sanyiri neighbourhood went to the street to protest against the murder of a policeman by a local retail trader. The main road was blocked and the murderer's store was plundered.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)

NOTES: Unknown gunmen opened fire on the gendarmerie 21h in Djibasso, Kossi Province near the Mali border. Customs officer who was close to the gendarmerie killed in the attack & material damages (mainly motorbikes)

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: 2 individuals abducted by unknown gunmen this morning in Kourfadji (Nassoumbou).

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: The mayor's office in Diguel, Soum attacked by presumed Ansaroul Islam members, material damages & the accountant abducted.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Three individuals incl. Wendpoli village chief assassinated overnight in the Soum, near Mali border.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam

NOTES: Convoy of fuel trucks escorted by the gendarmerie subjected to IED+gunfire attack along the Tongomayel-Inata axis. 2 dead and several wounded among security forces. 2 more died at the hospital.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)

NOTES: The gendarmerie post in Toeni was attacked by unidentified gunmen. No casualties, but material damages

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Looting: Attack reported in Tongomayel, same axis Dori-Djibo, no details regarding targets or eventual casualty toll.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Police station in Solle, Loroum Province attacked by heavily armed gunmen.

NOTES: Property destruction: On 19 October 2017, ISGS militants burned the primary school in Tem (Nassoumbou, Soum).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Gunmen on motorbikes attempted to abduct the son of a councilman in Koutougou. He escaped.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)

ACTOR1: Koglweogo Militia
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: Clashes took place on Monday night in Yorko, a village in the municipality of Zabre. According to the same sources, the incident was between members of the self-defense group (koglweogo) and gendarmes.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 10 November 2017, the Burkinabe army clashed with presumed Ansaroul Islam militants in the area of Ariel, at least four militants were killed and four soldiers wounded including one severely who later succumbed to his wounds.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Protesters blocked access to the locality by barricading the section of the national road running through the city. They demand the resignation of the mayor and the establishment of a special delegation to manage their municipality until the next elections.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Property destruction: Unknown gunmen burned the primary school including three motorbikes and other materiel in Gountoure Kiri, department of Deou; teachers at the school managed to hide themselves amidst the attack

NOTES: High school students who were protesting violence by Koglweogos against a fellow student beat Koglweogos in Tiebele commune. The students wanted to avenge one of their comrades.

NOTES: The locality of Taouremba was attacked by presumed Ansaroul Islam members, 4 Koglweogos and a village councilman killed, assailants withdrew. Claimed by JNIM on November, 24st: probably a second civilian dead.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)

NOTES: A police patrol was attacked around the area of Nongodoum, near the Mali border. Casualties unknown. The attack was later claimed by JNIM.

NOTES: Property destruction: The villages of Gountour-Gnegne and Gountour-Kiri visited by gunmen who seized two motorbikes and burned one belonging to ICRC veterinarians who were conducting a vaccination campaign.

NOTES: AESO students went on a 72-hours strike and organised a sit-in and a march.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Property destruction: Two presumed Ansaroul Islam members opened fire in the village of Oukoulourou about 11km from Baraboule. The gunmen ransacked the home of a councilman and also visited a local notable, telling him that they would return to the village in order to get their hands on the absent councilman. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 1 December 2017, two presumed Malian refugees at the Mentao camp were killed in Ariel while en route to the market in Boulkessi, Mali. The two were likely to have been killed in the crossfire amidst clashes raging between Ansaroul Islam and the burkinabe army, or mistaken for militants.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
NOTES: Military vehicle struck by IED/mine in the area of Tounte, 4 wounded. Claimed by JNIM on 26/12.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: The RN1 was blocked with barriers by students in Tita who were demonstrating to support their teachers and denounce the lack of teachers since the beginning of the year in their schools. They clashed with a joint force of police and soldiers sent to disperse them.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SYNTAS: The National Union of Social Action Workers
NOTES: The National Union of Social Action Workers (SYNTAS) has engaged a 96 hours strike since 19 December 2017. The strike aims to denounce the contemptuous attitude and silence of their ministry and the government over their demands. Attendance at the picket line observed by the National Union of Social Action Workers (SYNTAS) is becoming more and more mobilized compared to previous protests.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Looting: Gunmen opened fire in the village of Damba, some 40km northeast of Djibo, Soum province and seized a motorbike, after they moved to the nearby locality of Bouro and seized 60 cattle. No reported injuries.

NOTES: Looting: Gunmen opened fire in the village of Damba, some 40km northeast of Djibo, Soum province and seized a motorbike, after they moved to the nearby locality of Bouro and seized 60 cattle.

The report mentions a policeman killed, another seriously injured and a motorcycle and two weapons carried by the attackers.

NOTES: CNSE organised a sit-in to protest against government's educational policy.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen attacked the village of Kacham-Ouest on the Mali border in Tin Akoff department, Oudalan province. The school was burned down, an abduction also reported.

NOTES: The students of the Pouytenga County High School kidnapped their headmaster. They demanded teachers of Physics and Chemistry (CP) who are lacking since the beginning of the school year. On the sidelines of protests over the crisis in the education system, LDP students raised their voice at the lack of PC teachers in their school. They locked up the headmaster in his office, for three hours, to solve the problem of the lack of teachers of PC which they thought was too long.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students from Pouytenga, Sapaga and surrounding areas demonstrated to denounce the government's silence over the lack of evaluation since the start of the school year. The big crossroads of Sapaga that was blocked for 4 hours.
