ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Presumed Islamists visited the primary school of Vini, Titao Dept., Loroum Province leaving behind writings on tables and walls with intimidating messages, calling on teachers to educate in Arabic in place of French or face consequences.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: On 1 February 2018, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants assassinated a municipal councilor and a village chief in the village of Tiemboulo.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 2 February 2018, protesters in Matiakoali demanded the release of 17 individuals arrested during a previous protest that turned violent, security forces dispersed the protest by firing tear gas.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Police used teargas to disperse the crowd claiming a correction of the Tapao-Boko forest's borders.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Police post in Deou, Oudalan Province attacked not long ago by two unknown gunmen, one of the assailants killed according to information currently available

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Another extrajudicial killing (of a youth described as suffering of mental disorder/intellectual disability) by Burkinabe security forces in hamlet not far from Baraboule, following the attack that killed two policemen in the area of Petegoli.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Students in Tikare, 25km from Kongoussi staged a sit-in, demanding the administration to organize the schoolyear in semesters instead of quarters, staff at the school were forced to lock themselves inside the offices as protection against the angry students.

ACTOR1: Government of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: Security Measures: Nightly curfew and traffic ban imposed in all villages in the commune of Deou, Oudalan Province, entered into force on February 9.

ACTOR1: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
NOTES: On 13 February 2018, presumed ISGS militants attacked a police patrol in the village of PK60 (Fada Ngourma, Gourma), near Natiaboani. One policeman was killed and two others wounded.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Angry protesters stormed and closed down the mayor's office in Matiakoali, dissatisfied with how the mayor has handled the crisis surrounding grazing land in the area.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
NOTES: High-profile attack in Ouagadougou simultaneously targeted the Chief of Staff Headquarters and the French Embassy. The attack was initiated by the detonation of an explosives-laden vehicle at the Chief of Staff headquarters. Militants attacked guard posts at sites with light weapons, and gunfire was reported in the capital throughout the day. In the evening, when operations to counter the attacks had ended, eight assailants were reportedly killed, four at each location. According to official sources, eight members of Burkina's defense and security were also confirmed killed and as many as 90 wounded, including a dozen severely. The casualty toll could continue to rise as the situation evolves and the dust settles. JNIM claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 4 March 2018, three individuals approached a checkpoint near the Presidential palace in Ouaga 2000, one aboard a motorbike attempted to force through the checkpoint manned by the presidential guard (GSPR). Two escaped while one was arrested, the latter attempted to take a weapon from one of the soldiers while detained and was shot dead.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Forest Guards
NOTES: On 7 March 2018, presumed JNIM militants attacked and exchanged gunfire with forest rangers in the area of Tanwalbougou (Fada Ngourma, Gourma). There were no casualties.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On March 9 , protesters demanding the dissolution of the municipal council in Matiacoali, forced the mayor to close down the mayor's office and hand over the keys to the protesters.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: On 9 March 2018, a group of gunmen aboard motorbikes, presumably Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a villager in Douhoure (Koutougou).

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 9 March 2018, Kouba residents went to Koubri to protest against a real estate developer who had bought land in the area, the group was prevented to enter Koubri by another group and street fighting erupted, one individual was wounded by a machete.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Forest Guards
NOTES: On 9 March 2018, presumed JNIM militants attacked and opened fire on forest guards at a forest guard post in the area of Nassougou (Matiacoali, Gourma). The assailants seized two motorbikes.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
NOTES: On 10 March 2018, the vehicle of a concessionaire was struck by an IED in the Singou natural reserve about 20km south of Tanwalbougou (approx coordinates used), no casualties were recorded but the vehicle was severely damaged.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 13 March 2018, the Burkinabe police exchanged gunfire with two gunmen near the Sogea-Satom's offices in Karpala, Ouagadougou. One of the gunmen was arrested while the other escaped. A motorbike, an AK, a semi-automatic handgun, three filled magazines and 80 ammunition cartridges were also seized.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 13 March 2018, the counter-terrorism task force GFAT arrested a civilian at the market in Nassoumbou who after his arrest was extrajudicially executed.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Forest Guards
NOTES: On 15 March 2018, overnight presumed JNIM militants attacked a forest guard post in Nassougou (Matiacoali, Gourma). One ranger was killed and a vehicle burned. This is the second attack in this area in less than a week.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022) Gendarmerie
NOTES: On 17 March 2018, an unknown gunman opened fire on a unit of customs officers in Di, Sourou Province near the Mali border. One customs officer gunshot wounded and a weapon seized, border police pursued the assailant who opened fire once again before being shot dead, according to authorities. However, local sources said that the concerned individual refused to be checked by the customs officers at the market and attacked them with a machete, wounding one customs officer severely, then seized a weapon and opened fire. The area in question from widespread racketeering and extortion activities by security forces including customs officers and local officials.

ACTOR1: Islamic Security Militia
NOTES: Formation of armed group: On March 20, the Sunni Movement of Pouytenga established an Islamist militia called Islamic Security, its creation sparked a vivid debate, and authorities responded by ordering its disbandment.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: On 21 March 2018, Presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a councilman in the village of Lassa, Soum Province, the councilman was taken to an unknown destination.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Burkina Faso (2015-2022); Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 21 March 2018, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants opened fire on the residence of the prefect in Oursi. He died in a second targeted attack two months later.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 26 March 2018, a storage containing explosives detonated at the Mobile Customs Brigade in Bobo-Dioulasso, one customs officer and a cleaning woman were killed in the blast.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
ACTOR2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
NOTES: On 27 March 2018, Burkinabe defense and security forces raided a presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants camp near the village of Bakani in Foutouri commune, Komondjari Province not far from the Niger border, two presumed militants were reportedly wounded and arms, ammunition and other objects seized. It is believed that militants from the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara crossed the Niger border into Burkina Faso and set up the camp targeted.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 30 March 2018, protesters attempted to prevent the holding of municipal council meeting in Matiacoali, security forces alerted came to the scene and dispersed the protesters, several were wounded.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
NOTES: Property destruction: On April 1, presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants burned a timber transport truck near the forest of Kodjagabeli, area of Tangounga.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 3 April 2018, unknown gunmen attacked and gunshot wounded two Dogon herders coming from Mali in the area of Dore, the gunmen also seized their herd of livestock.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: On 5 April 2018, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants on motorbikes attacked a secondary school in Belehede (Tongomayel, Soum). The militants fired gunshots in the air and at the building, causing teachers and students to flee, and burned offices, school equipment, and the principal's motorcycle.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 5 April 2018, protesters marched in Ouagadougou demanding improved housing.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam
NOTES: On 5 April 2018, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants on motorbikes abducted the municipal councillor of Gomde-Fulbe who also is the village chief of Basnere in his home village in Djibo.

ACTOR1: Ansaroul Islam

A significant amount of weapons, ammunition, explosives and other military equipment including military uniforms of the Burkina and French army were seized. The operation likely thwarted another major attack in Ouagadougou.

Coded as two separate events.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
NOTES: Around 4 June 2021 (between 4 - 5 June), suspected JNIM militants attacked the town of Solhan (Solhan, Yagha). The attack targeted a volunteer fighter (VDP) position and mining sites in Solhan and in the neighboring villages of Mossiga and Gountoure. The militants killed around 160 people and wounded 147 others, burned and pillaged vehicles, houses, shops, and the market. JNIM denied responsibility and condemned the attack, although local JNIM subgroups are believed to have carried out the attack.

NOTES: On 9 December 2021, presumed Ansaroul Islam or Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants ambushed a group of volunteer fighters near the village of You (Titao, Loroum). Fourteen people including thirteen VDPs and one motor taxi driver were killed and a twelve others wounded including four severely. The militants also seized weapons and motorcycles. JNIM claimed responsibility in an unofficial video.

ACTOR2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (West Africa) - Greater Sahara Faction
NOTES: Around 19 January 2022 (between 15 - 23 January), Burkinabe and French forces carried 'Operation Laabingol' in the Centre-Nord and Sahel regions with the operation centered around the town of Kelbo (Kelbo, Soum). 163 presumed JNIM or ISWAP (Greater Sahara) militants were killed including a Kelbo militant commander named Mdouli aka Abdramane. 4 militant bases and a logistic depot were destroyed, 6 IEDs discovered, arms, ammo, means of transport and communication, foodstuff, medicine and other material seized or destroyed. One soldier was killed and two others wounded. Fatalities in Kelbo coded as 104. Remaining 60 fatalities coded in five separate events. Several local sources indicated that 'many innocent people' people were killed and that summary executions that occurred around Kelbo. JNIM acknowledged that 11 fighters were killed in the operation and denied the death of Mdouli aka Abdramane.

ACTOR1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
NOTES: On 23 January 2022, mutinous soldiers attacked the presidential guard in Patte d'Oie quarter in the capital Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). Several guards were wounded and vehicles riddled with bullets. The ruling MPP party issued a statement saying that the mutinous soldiers had attempted to assassinate President Roch Kabore and a minister, encircled the Kosyam Palace, occupied the national radio and television, vandalized the presidential residence, and destroyed private and public property. Two civilians were killed and twelve others wounded by stray bullets on during the coup events of 23 and 24 January. Fatalities are split across two events.

ACTOR1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-2022)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MPSR: Patriotic Movement for Safeguarding and Restoration
NOTES: Coup/military takeover: On 24 January 2022, mutinous soldiers announced seizing power and creating a military junta named the Patriotic Movement for Safeguarding and Restoration (MPSR) in a televised speech in the capital of Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The soldiers also announced that President Roch Kabore was deposed after signing his resignation, and the constitution, the government, and the national assembly had been suspended. The junta also declared the closure of land and air borders and a night curfew. The leader of the military junta MPSR, Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba, was inaugurated as president on 16 February 2022. Two civilians were killed and twelve others wounded by stray bullets on during the coup events of 23 and 24 January. Fatalities are split across two events.

About 20 militants, 2 suicide bombers and 3 soldiers were killed, and 28 soldiers were wounded including 10 severely, according to a government statement. The attack also caused substantial material damages. JNIM claimed responsibility and acknowledged that it lost 7 fighters.

Eleven soldiers were killed. JNIM claimed responsibility by audio and said it killed 13 soldiers, acknowledged 10 JNIM fighters killed in two attacks carried out, and that the group seized a large amount of vehicles, weapons, and ammo. 16 total fatalities coded.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
NOTES: On 20 March 2022, presumed JNIM militants attacked Burkinabe soldiers near PK60 (Fada NGourma, Gourma). Thirteen soldiers were killed and ten wounded, including one soldier killed and another severely wounded in a subsequent IED attack during the withdrawal of the troops from the ambush site toward Natiaboani. The Burkinabe armed forces said that 'several' assailants were killed in the attack, and 36 'terrorists' in total during the ongoing operation. Fatalities among presumed JNIM split across three events around PK60, Napade, and Kortikio. JNIM claimed responsibility by audio and said it killed 24 soldiers, acknowledged 10 JNIM fighters killed in two attacks carried out, and that the group seized a large amount of vehicles, weapons, and ammo. 18 total fatalities coded.

People fled from the area to Gorom-Gorom following the operation.

The demonstrators denounced the poor condition of the main road and demanded better management of the local development mining fund by the mayor's office and transparency in the recruitment process of personnel.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2022-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2022-) Gendarmerie
ACTOR2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
NOTES: On 28 September 2022, soldiers and gendarmes escorting a civilian transport convoy clashed with presumed JNIM militants near Gaskinde (Pobe-Mengao, Soum). Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Rioters (Burkina Faso); MPSR: Patriotic Movement for Safeguarding and Restoration
NOTES: On 29 September 2022, several hundred residents predominantly traders staged a demonstration in the town of Bobo-Dioulasso (Bobo-Dioulasso, Houet). The demonstrators denounced the deteriorating security situation, called for military cooperation with Russia, the departure of French military forces, and the resignation of transition president Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba. Security forces and pro-MPSR supporters intervened to prevent the demonstrators to gather and disperse them. The security forces barricaded roads and pro-MPSR supporters whipped demonstrators.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 29 September 2022, a number of car vendors demonstrated in the capital of Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The demonstrators denounced a decision of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Burkina Faso (CCI-BF) to relocate a car vending park outside the city of Ouagadougou.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 30 September 2022, dozens of people staged a demonstration in the capital of Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The demonstrators waved Russian flags and demanded the withdrawal of French forces, an anti-French leader in power, and the resignation of transition president Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba.

ACTOR1: MPSR: Patriotic Movement for Safeguarding and Restoration
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2022-)
NOTES: Coup/military takeover: On 30 September 2022, mutinous soldiers announced seizing power, ousting transition president Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba, and naming captain Ibrahim Traore as leader of the junta movement MPSR in a televised speech in the capital of Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The soldiers had previously taken control of the Baba Sy military camp, major roads, and the national television station RTB. Heavy gunfire and explosions were reported throughout the day in the capital. The mutinous soldiers also declared a series of measures including the dissolution of the constitution, the transition charter, and the Transitional Legislative Assembly, the closure of land and air borders and a night curfew, and suspension of political and CSO activities.

ACTOR1: MPSR: Patriotic Movement for Safeguarding and Restoration
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2022-)
NOTES: On 30 September 2022, mutinous soldiers of the junta movement MPSR took control of the Baba Sy military camp, major roads, and the national television station RTB, with heavy gunfire and explosions reported throughout the day in Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: MPSR: Patriotic Movement for Safeguarding and Restoration

Fatalities are split across two events.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 27 October 2022, a number of people demonstrated and barricaded the main road near Boulmiougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The demonstrators denounced a decision to maintain in detention Lieutenant-Colonel Emmanuel Zoungrana who is accused of attempting to stage a coup d'etat and other offences.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 27 October 2022, a number of people staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Commerce in the capital of Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The demonstrators denounced the renomination of Donatien Nagalo as Minister in charge of Commerce. The investiture of Nagalo was postponed.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 28 October 2022, a number of people demonstrated in front of the Bila Zagre military camp in Kamboinsin (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The demonstrators called for the departure of French forces and handed over a letter to Burkinabe soldiers. One demonstrator got hit and wounded by a Burkinabe military vehicle.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 28 October 2022, a number of people demonstrated in the town of Bobo-Dioulasso (Bobo-Dioulasso, Houet). The demonstrators forced the closure of the market, waved Russian and Burkinabe flags, and denounced the presence of French forces and the renomination of certain ministers from the Damiba regime.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: On 28 October 2022, a number of people staged a demonstration at several locations including the Nation Square, the Municipal Stadium, the Grand Market of Rood-woko, and in front of the French Embassy in the capital of Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The demonstrators lit fires, waved Russian and Burkinabe flags, and called for the 'departure of France in Burkina'. The demonstrators were chased away by butchers with machetes when they attempted to force the closure of the Grand Market.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Burkina Faso); Pastoralists (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Around 7 November 2022 (between 6 - 9 November), soldiers and volunteer fighters (VDP) carried out an operation involving airstrikes and shellings in the villages and hamlets of Holde, Yate, Teri Maibe, Mehena, and Winde Bougel (Djibo, Soum). At least 42 people predominantly women and children from the Fulani Rimaibe community were killed. Fatalities are split across five events. JNIM condemned the events which the group described as a massacre.

The demonstrators denounced the management of the company, the low level of investment and non-compliance with the specifications in terms of staff recruitment as part of their revendicative platform.
